channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous ice!!, 4th January
item.description:
Dangerous ice patches. All down Friar Rd. Cars skidding, crossroads at the bottom of the hill. There will be a serious accident soon! Please grit the whole road urgently as the temp is due to drop further
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Friar Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: End of pavement on Highgate Road, parallel to Grove Terrace, 4th January
item.description:
I am a wheelchair user and a local resident living at 1 Arco Walk, college lane, Highgate Road, for just over one year. The ramp at this location is faulty. I cannot easily get onto the pavement, the ramp needs to be smoothed out please. I think it has a bit of a pothole which causes me to get stuck. Much appreciated.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Grove Terrace, Dartmouth Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside no 1 Arco walk in college lane, 4th January
item.description:
I am a wheelchair user and this bit of ramp Is not quite wide enough. It would be amazing ramp an be made slightly wider so that I can come off. I like right there in 1 Arco Walk on college lane. We moved here in Nov 2024 and this issue has always been a small Challenge. Much appreciated
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Lane, Dartmouth Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Worsening pothole, 4th January
item.description:
This has been deteriorating since a water leak a year ago. The other side was fixed by Thames water. This side is continuing to deteriorate. Significant hazard for cyclists and loud thumps every time a bus goes by. 2nd time reporting. The structural rigidity of the road seems to be affected as surrounding structures shake. Please fix!!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 149, Sidcup Hill, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Person parking car outside number 36 Crawthew Grove, 4th January
item.description:
This car is blocking the pavement and causing people who are walking with pushchairs or using wheelchairs to use the road which is dangerous. This is a long standing issue

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Crawthew Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent obstruction of the highway, 4th January
item.description:
Hi, I’d like to report a persistent obstruction of the highway. There’s a green wheelie bin left on the road/pavement outside a property on 85 dursley road. It’s been there continuously since November and not just on bin days. It’s obstructing parking and access, and there’s already been a dispute because of it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dursley Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice pathy need salting, 4th January
item.description:
I slipped on the ice as its bad allover the pathy no salt box anywhere near by we need soat boxes even at the bus stop as you come out off ravensworth road very slippy we more salt boxes as soon as possible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Farm Road, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Icy pathways/roads next to school entrance, 4th January
item.description:
Every winter Oxhawth Crescent becomes an ice rink. There is a school entrance on the road (Southborough Primary School) and there are always issues with people slipping over. Please can this pavement/road be included when everywhere else is being gritted? It should be a given that paths to schools are gritted. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxhawth Crescent, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Codeine Bottles and other trash including NOS gas tanks, 4th January
item.description:
Constant litter from the window of 9 Moreton House, Slippers Place. Trash being thrown at night straight from bedroom window. Also likely from an underage person. Mostly bottles of codeine, sometimes random trash and just recently found a full tank of NOS gas. This keeps happening almost every week. Issue has been going on for at least 3 months. We keep collecting the trash ourselves as sometimes it ends up on communal pathway or ever our private garden.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gataker Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose paving sticking out dangerously into road, 4th January
item.description:
There is a single loose paving slab sticking out into the cycle lane/road on the left hand side approaching waterloo bridge, that a pedestrian could trip on or a cyclist could hit. It seems to because dead leaves or something is behind it and has loosened it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Charlie Chaplin Walk, Waterloo, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
